page.title: 06LANDSCAPE 2
page.content: typical weekday afternoon.The main feature is Thingwall Hall, a residential home for mentally-handicapped men, cared for by the Brothers of Charity. It encompasses an area of sixty acres and cows and sheep were grazing contentedly in the surrounding fields.There are greenhouses,rockeries,a vegetable garden,a full-sized football pitch,two ornamental ponds, an aviary and stables. The hall and its environs are perched on a hill, affording a fine view of the district. The children noticed that the neighbouring houses are mainly semi-detached, situated in quiet, litter-free roads.At the junction of Pilch Lane and Swanside Road there is a row of shops, including a grocer, fish and chips, sweets,glazier,pets,
